metadata.Title: CVE-2023-5171 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
During Ion compilation, a Garbage Collection could have resulted in a use-after-free condition, allowing an attacker to write two NUL bytes, and cause a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 118, Firefox ESR < 115.3, and Thunderbird < 115.3.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5171` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs102 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2').
